questions.question: Creation of a template can help facilitate future data imports and be reused to import and transform data.

comments.content: A (TRUE) is the right answer
It is surely A
A (TRUE)

SAM Professional Fundamentals course, Trustworthy Data, Importing Software Data Using System Import Sets, Import Data: Create Or Update?: Create a template 

You can take steps to facilitate future data imports if you plan to import regularly. One of the easiest methods is to set up a spreadsheet or comma-separated value (CSV) template for the data you wish to import. Define the columns in the table view to export and set a filter to export a smaller subset of data. Because the data structure is the same for every import, you can reuse the import set table and transform it. Furthermore, your System Administrator can set up a scheduled import to occur regularly.
ServiceNow has a template that you can use, but it does not look like creating your own (or altering their version) is recommended.
replies: Misread this in the documentation. Agree with A (True).

questions.question: Client access is the right to use for a specific amount of time.

comments.content: B is the right answer

B- In Software Asset Management, client access generally refers to the right for a client (such as a user or device) to access and use specific software. It does not inherently imply a specific time limit; rather, it is usually tied to the terms of the software license, which could be perpetual, subscription-based, or otherwise defined by the license agreement. The right to use for a specific amount of time would typically be described as a subscription or term license, not client acces
Software subscription: rights to use software for a specific amount of time. Who’s using a subscription software and the last time there was activity.

SAM Professional Fundamentals course, Practical Management, Practical Management Overview, Common Terms: Client Access is a software license measured by the number of users or devices that can access a product.
B is correct
B, Subscription is the definition

questions.question: Coalesce can only use a single field to uniquely identify a record.

comments.content: Coalesce can be applied on multiple fields

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/import-sets/concept/c_ImportSetCoalesce.html

Multiple-field coalesce
You can coalesce on multiple fields to update an existing record.

If a target table record exists with the same values in all coalesce fields as the staging table record, the target table record is updated using the staging table record values. All coalesce field values between the target and staging tables must match to coalesce with multiple fields.
How is it possible to have so many wrong answers flagged as correct.

There is a question later talking about coalescing on multiple fields.

Most of the answers on this study guide are WRONG. Make sure you read the discussions, where documentation is normally provided.

questions.question: Which statements are true in regards to ServiceNow’s Client Software Distribution (CSD) functionality? (Choose two.)
answers: A. Removes software daily utilizing a scheduled job.
B. ServiceNow does not have Client Software Distribution.
C. The first stage in the CSD process flow is configuration.
D. CSD can automatically distribute and reclaim software without a license for Orchestration.

comments.content: can't be D, as there is separate subscription needed for distribution (orchestration)

Does anyone have any proof that A is correct? When scanning the documentation (https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_SCCMSoftwareRevocation.html)  it suggests that removal is handled via Workflow Activities, not some form of scheduled job. 

I'm leaning towards D, as no Orchestration license is required for CSD if SAM is already installed. I'm making an assumption that it is installed as part of this question as this is what the exam is on.
Okay I want to give a new answer because D is not true, Orchestration plugin is needed for reclamation.

It's AC:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_ClientSoftwareDistribution.html
replies:
Request client software distribution

Client software distribution requires the Orchestration - Client Software Distribution plugin (com.snc.orchestration.client_sf_distribution), which is available by request with a subscription to Orchestration.

comments.content:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_ClientSoftwareDistribution.html

The Client Software Distribution (CSD) application allows administrators to distribute software from the service catalog using third-party management systems.

CSD allows an administrator to create all the records necessary to deploy software from service catalog requests, including software models and catalog items. You can use the CSD application to automate the deployment and revocation of software from an SCCM host using the custom SCCM activity pack. You can define lease periods for software distributed from the Service Catalog and allow lease extensions in some cases, pending approvals. Deployment is accomplished using Orchestration activities and workflows.

There is also a picture there that shows Configuration as the first step.

The diagram shows "Configuration" as stage 1 = C. 
" You can use the CSD application to automate the deployment and revocation of software from an SCCM host using the custom SCCM activity pack." = D

Sources: CSD - https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-servicenow-platform/page/product/orchestration/concept/c_ClientSoftwareDistribution.html

SCCM Activity Pack outlining the Orchestration functions without the need for a separate license: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/rome-servicenow-platform/page/administer/orchestration-activities/concept/c_SCCMActivityPack.html

The full CSD product allows administrators to distribute, manage, and revoke software/ reclaim license automation, only revocation/reclamation capability is entitled as part of SAM. Full use of CSD product requires the Orchestration - Clien Software Distribution.
Which means you cannot distribute without Orchestration license as its said in asnwer D.

While SAM relies on Orchestration to perform software reclamation, the actual functionality is included in the SAM Professional license (i.e., the revocation/reclamation capability is entitled as part of SAM Pro). You do not need to own/purchase Orchestration separately in order to revoke software/reclaim license rights using SAM Pro.
replies: This is where I have a problem with the question when looking at the other comments. Surely if the course/exam is centered around SAM, then there is no requirement to purchase a license for Orchestration as you will already have it as part of SAM. This is why I was leaning towards D being correct.

comments.content: D is not correct, I believe correct answer is A & C

questions.question: If a value from an import does not exist in ServiceNow and the import should not create a new record, which option should be selected?

comments.content:
The right answer is A: Reject to not create a record, if "ignore" is selected, the record will still me created.

create: Create a new choice or record in the reference table.
ignore: Ignore the new value from the source table.
reject: Skip the entire row (record) containing the new value and continue to the next row.

The question is not clear about what record should not be created as in this scenario the transform would be creating two records, not one. 

There are two possibilities:
- If the transforms target record should not be created, then Reject is the correct answer as this will stop the creation of the new choice or reference data and also block the insert of the target record
- If the target choice or reference records should not be created, then Ignore would be a more appropriate option. This would allow the insert of the target record but block the insert of the new choice/reference data and leave the associated field on the target record empty. Reject would also work here but that would be throwing the baby out with the bath water.

Delete is not a valid choice and Create is the happy path where you want to insert the related record

A. Reject will skip the record. 
Ignore will create a record, but leave the field empty or filled with default value.

Correct Answer D
Ignore, ignores the value
Reject, rejects the whole row
it should be ignore

questions.question: What are the four tiers of software reconciliation results? (Choose four.)

comments.content: SOFTWARE METRIC IS RIGHT AND NOT SOFTWARE ALLOCATION

Four tiers of reconciliation results:
-	Software publisher: results for all products and installations associated to the publisher
-	Software product: results for all models and installations associated to the product. Generated after reconciliation, even if there are no software models defined for the product. Displays information such as Software Model Results, Unlicensed Installs, Removal candidates etc.
-	Software model: results for all license metrics related to the software model. Only created when a software model or entitlement exists for the product.
-	License metric: results for each license metric associated to the software model.
Based on SAM Fundamentals

Six common license metrics:
-	Per Core: licenses cores on a physical server or virtual machine (CPU core count)
-	Per Device: licenses a device for a number of installations of software
-	Per Named Device: licenses a specific device for a number of installations of software
-	Per User: licenses a user for a number of installations of software
-	Per Named User: licenses a specific user for a number of installations of software
-	Per Processor (CPU count): licenses processors on either a physical server or virtual machine
I agree, this should e B - Per Named Device

questions.question: Which of the following license metrics require allocations in order to maintain compliance? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
C,D
Allocations needed: number of allocations needed for compliance (only used for Per Named User and Per Named Device license metrics)

-	License metric: results for each license metric associated to the software model. License metric rights allocations are calculated for:
o	Allocated in use: software license that is allocated and used to license installations.
o	Not allocated in use: software license that is used to license installations but not allocated.
o	Allocated not in use: software license that is allocated but not used to license installations.
o	Not allocated: number of available rights that have not been allocated (installed or not)
o	Allocations needed: number of allocations needed for compliance (only used for Per Named User and Per Named Device license metrics)
C and D is correct
Correct answer is C and D

questions.question: Which of the following is not a core Software Asset Management function?

comments.content: Shouldn't this be A Financial management ?

Do you think the answer is C?
Core functions of SAM:
Software reconciliation 
- The process of producing a compliance position by comparing the number of software rights acquired against the normalized software inventory
Software reclamation 
- The process of identifying unused software and uninstalling it so that the software rights for the user or device can be repurposed
Software Spend 
- The ServiceNow Software Spend Detection application enables you to track, analyze, and optimize IT software spending from imported financial data.
A - Financial management is not a SAM function. Financial data can be imported for Change projection etc ~ SAM on-demand course

I agree Financial Management - A.  Per SAM Fundamentals - SAM facilitates the tracking, evolution, and management of software license rights, compliance and optimization.  Which my interpretation is  License rights = Rights allocation, Compliance = Inventory Managment, Optimization = reclamation.  No where does it say financial management.
I actually would like to update my answer to "D - Inventory Management": https://www.servicenow.com/products/it-asset-management/what-is-inventory-management.html

Looking at the Asset Workspace, there is a lot of inventory and financial management. Allocation happens at/after procurement. Reclamation is not required, but should be happening for products, therefore I vote B, Reclamation. You have to do all else, but reclamation is not required.

questions.question:
HOTSPOT -
Define the three catalogs that support the request and procurement process.

comments.content:
From the SAM Pro training (Software Request and Sourcing):

Service Catalog: Central listing of goods and services an organization provides - End users order from the Service Catalog.

Product Catalog: Collection of Models in the environment - models can be easily published to the Product Catalog and are then automatically published to the Service Catalog.

Vendor Catalog: Listing of goods available from a vendor - items in the Vendor Catalog link to models in the Product Catalog.

This one is confusing between Product and Service Catalogs. 

Product Catalog = "Listing of goods an organization provides."  https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/product-catalog/concept/c_ProductCatalog.html

Service Catalog = "Collection of Models in the environment" https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-servicenow-platform/page/product/service-catalog-management/concept/c_IntroductionToCatalogItems.html

This video really explains it: https://www.servicenow.com/community/training-and-certifications/service-catalog-administration-overview/ta-p/2297657

I found this blog/discussion to be helpful about Product and Service Catalog differences and uses: https://www.servicenow.com/community/now-platform-forum/service-catalog-items-vs-product-catalog-items-hardware-software/m-p/1058403
 
Vendor Catalog = "Listing of goods offered or available by a third party". This one is pretty clear.
replies:
I was so bothered by this one, I pressed on and Question #145 of this exam asks: "Which catalog provides a collection of models in the environment?" and the correct answer was "C.Product Catalog". 

Product Catalog, as it's a collection of models in the environment.

(it is not service catalog, as that is a listing of goods and services an organization provides.)

questions.question: As part of the discovery process, when records are written to the software installation table a check is performed to determine if the information already exists in the discovery model table, if a record exists, what does the system do?
answers: A. The record is deleted and recreated to ensure the most recent discovery model is recorded.
B. Nothing, the record exists so it is ignored.
C. A new record is created for the installation in the discovery model table.
D. A reference to the discovery model record is identified and associated to the software installation record.

comments.content:
It's answer D - referenced on page 112 in the SAM manual that came with the SAM course.

* if it does exist, a reference to the Discovery Model records is identified in the Software installation table.
* If it does not exist:
 - A new record is created for the installation in the Discovery Model table.
- The reference number to the new record is then identified in the Software Installation table.

questions.question: What are the available actions associated with the Normalization Suggestions feature? (Choose two.)
answers: A. Accept – updates the discovery model with suggested values
B. Reject – ignores the suggestion. The next time the scheduled job is executed, it will not pick the same package or rule that was rejected previously
C. Save – allows you to save the suggestion to review again later
D. Ignore – ignores the suggestion. All fields are updated to read only until the next time the job is executed with the same package or rule that was ignored previously.
E. Create – creates a discovery model with suggested values

questions.question: Within ServiceNow Discovery, the Identification phase determines what?
answers: A. Have I seen you before?
B. How should I classify you specifically?
C. What else can you tell me about yourself?
D. Are you there? How will I classify you?

comments.content:
The correct answer is:

A. Have I seen you before?
During the Identification phase in ServiceNow Discovery, the system determines whether the discovered device or CI (Configuration Item) already exists in the Configuration Management Database (CMDB). It compares the discovered attributes against existing records to avoid duplicate entries and ensure accurate asset tracking.

Identification: After classification, the police check their records to see if the suspect has a criminal history. They ask, “Have we seen you before?” ...https://www.servicenow.com/community/itom-articles/servicenow-discovery-4-phase-process-pcie-through-a-simple-crime/ta-p/3091330

questions.question: What is unmanaged spend when viewing the Software Spend Detection Overview dashboard?
answers: A. The total spend for transactions where the publisher and product are identified but there's no software model identified for the product
B. The total spend for transactions where the publisher, product, and software model are identified but there's no software installations identified for the product
C. The total spend for transactions that are not identified as an accounts payable spend or an expense spend
D. The total spend for transactions that are identified for an unmanaged publisher

comments.content:
The correct answer is:

A. The total spend for transactions where the publisher and product are identified but there's no software model identified for the product.
Unmanaged spend refers to software expenses where the relevant publisher and product are known, but no corresponding software model has been established within the system. This represents a potential compliance risk and indicates areas where further management and oversight are needed to align spending with organizational policies

Total spend for transactions where the publisher and product are identified but there's no software model for the product... https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/software-spend-detection-overview-dashboard.html

questions.question: What is required to manage utilization of the Software Asset Management Content Service?
answers: A. The service must be opted in to and can be opted out of n the future if required
B. The service is automatically enabled through the baseline installation but can be opted out of if required
C. A script must be defied to identify what information should be shared with the Content Service

comments.content:
The correct answer is:

A. The service must be opted in to and can be opted out of in the future if required
The Software Asset Management (SAM) Content Service requires organizations to opt in to leverage its features, such as receiving updated software recognition rules and normalization content. If necessary, organizations can later opt out to discontinue participation without affecting their core SAM operations.
